revised_title: Anatomy and Function of the Porpoise's Blow-Hole
tldr: The author, Francis Sibson, examines the blow-hole of the porpoise and its anatomical features. He describes the external opening, the air passage, and the muscular tube that divides the nasal canals. Sibson also explains the function of the pouches, which help buoy up the head and allow the porpoise to breathe while submerged.
